body_content.explanation: the fact of being eligible (= having the necessary qualities or satisfying the necessary conditions) for something again, for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: Each request for re-eligibility will be considered individually.
The reeligibility enrolment procedures can prove to be a bureaucratic barrier for some people.

body_content.explanation: the fact of being able to be elected again to the same position, for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: The original Constitution of the United States did not prescribe any limit to the re-eligibility of the President, so the 22nd Amendment added the limits of two terms.
